agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: County Affairs TIME & DATE: 10:30 AM or upon final adjourn./recess or during bill referral if permission is granted. Friday, April 12, 2019 PLACE: E2.028 CHAIR: Rep. Garnet Coleman The committee will meet to consider pending business and hear public testimony on the following: HB 956 Miller | et al. Relating to the dissolution of county assistance districts. HB 1120 Miller | et al. Relating to the powers of county assistance districts. HB 2007 Leach Relating to the enforcement of traffic regulations on a public road that is owned, operated, and maintained by a special district. HB 2347 Noble | et al. Relating to a microchip scan of animals in the custody of an animal shelter or releasing agency. HB 2527 Leach Relating to a requirement that certain water districts make audio and video recordings of open meetings available on the Internet. HB 2741 Minjarez Relating to the application of the fire code to and the inspection of buildings owned or leased by counties; authorizing a fee. HB 3001 Morrison Relating to the fiscal transparency of special purpose districts and other political subdivisions. HB 3002 Morrison Relating to certain audit and reporting requirements of regional planning commissions. HB 3203 Dean Relating to the division of certain emergency services districts. HB 3307 White | et al. Relating to the authority of an emergency services district to provide public health services; authorizing a fee. HB 3430 Hunter Relating to the transfer of a retired county law enforcement dog. HB 3610 Walle Relating to local control of the employment matters of officers of the sheriff's department in certain counties. HB 3727 Swanson Relating to the online publication of information by certain special purpose districts. HB 3759 Nevárez Relating to the type of newspaper required for publication of notice in small municipalities and rural counties. HB 3837 Coleman Relating to the offense of failure to comply with an order from a fire marshal and the authority of certain county employees to issue citations for certain violations; changing a criminal penalty. HB 4075 Perez Relating to the time for dissolution of a fire control, prevention, and emergency medical services district. HB 4117 Walle Relating to the authority of certain counties to acquire a right-of-way in accordance with the county's master drainage plan. HB 4308 Walle Relating to conditions of employment for an employee of certain sheriff's or constable's departments. HB 4350 Bohac Relating to emergency communications districts. HB 4457 Dominguez Relating to the minimum number of county jailers necessary to staff a county jail. HB 4532 Hunter Relating to the development and posting by county governments of lists of local mental health resources available to the public. HB 4559 Fierro Relating to access to a county jail prisoner's health benefits coverage information for mental health service providers. HB 4644 Bell, Cecil Relating to the creation of the Wood Trace Management District of Montgomery County, Texas; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, and taxes. HB 4657 Bell, Cecil Relating to the creation of the Montgomery County Management District No. 1; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, and taxes. HB 4653 Bailes Relating to the creation of Tarkington Management District No. 1 of Liberty County; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, or taxes. HB 4661 Bailes Relating to the creation of Plum Creek Management District No. 1 of Liberty County; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, or taxes. HB 4667 Hernandez Relating to the creation of the East Houston Management District; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, or taxes. HB 4676 Stephenson | et al. Relating to the creation of the Fort Bend County Management District No. 3; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, and taxes. HB 4701 Nevárez Relating to the creation of the West Pecos Management District; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, and taxes. HB 4703 Coleman Relating to the creation of the Harris County Improvement District No. 28; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, and taxes. HB 4714 Bell, Cecil Relating to the powers, duties, and governance of the Westwood Magnolia Parkway Improvement District; providing authority to impose taxes and issue bonds. Notice of this meeting was announced from the house floor. ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
